```{r setup, include=FALSE}
options(htmltools.dir.version = FALSE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  fig.width=15, fig.height=8, fig.retina=3,
  #out.width = "100%",
  cache = FALSE,
  echo = TRUE,
  message = FALSE, 
  warning = FALSE,
  hiline = TRUE
)

# Load libraries and custom functions ------------------------------------------
suppressPackageStartupMessages(source(here::here("packages.R")))
for (f in list.files(here::here("R"), full.names = TRUE)) source (f)

targets::tar_load(c(ihtm_class_list, ihtm_commits, ihtm_pulls))

# targets::tar_load(
#   c(ihtm_class_list, ihtm_repositories, ihtm_branches, ihtm_commits, 
#     ihtm_pulls, ihtm_pull_commits, ihtm_reviews, ihtm_commits_per_author,
#     ihtm_commits_by_pulls, ihtm_rates, ihtm_rates_per_author)
# )

ihtm_commits_df <- ihtm_commits |>
  dplyr::filter(!committer.login %in% c("ernestguevarra", "ihtm-bot", "github-classroom[bot]", "web-flow")) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    ihtm_class = dplyr::case_when(
      committer.login %in% ihtm_class_list$login[ihtm_class_list$ihtm_class == "class-2020"] ~ 2020,
      committer.login %in% ihtm_class_list$login[ihtm_class_list$ihtm_class == "class-2021"] ~ 2021,
      committer.login %in% ihtm_class_list$login[ihtm_class_list$ihtm_class == "class-2022"] ~ 2022,
      committer.login %in% ihtm_class_list$login[ihtm_class_list$ihtm_class == "class-2023"] ~ 2023,
      committer.login %in% ihtm_class_list$login[ihtm_class_list$ihtm_class == "class-2024"] ~ 2024,
    )
  ) |>
  dplyr::group_by(ihtm_class) |>
  dplyr::summarise(
    n_commits = n(),
    n_authors = n_distinct(committer.login),
    n_repositories = n_distinct(repository)
  ) |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    n_commits_author = n_commits / n_authors,
    n_commits_author_repository = n_commits_author / n_repositories
  ) |>
  dplyr::ungroup()
```

)

```{r commits-year, echo = FALSE, fig.align = "center", fig.width = 10}
ihtm_commits_df |>
  dplyr::group_by(ihtm_class) |>
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(ihtm_class)) |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = ihtm_class, y = n_commits)) +
  geom_col(fill = get_oxford_colours("sky blue")) +
  labs(
    title = "Total commits by IHTM class",
    subtitle = "2022-2024",
    x = NULL, y = "No. of commits"
  ) +
  theme_oxford()
```
